column4: I was only able to run xsane as root due to a permissions problem, solved by chmod-ing the usb device. Does it work under sudo?
hp f380 is not in /etc/sane.d. is that the end of the matter?
under /dev/usb there is only lp0 and it is now 660.
the entry I changed on mine was /dev/bus/usb/005/008 to crw-rw-r--
